question.title: I am running a HTML code on a springboot which is misplaced while going on mail
question.body:
Actually i wrote a code in Java which is responsible to format a HTML birthday card according to employee birthday. Issue i am facing that if the mail is open on thunderbird it is perfect but while mail is open on outlook the format is misarranged.

public static String generateBirthdayHtml(String fullName) {
    String firstName = extractFirstName(fullName);
    System.out.println("First Name:"+firstName );
    
    return  "<html>\n" +

            "    <title>Birthday Greeting</title>\n" +
            "    <style>\n" +
            "        body { \n" +
            "            font-family: Arial, sans-serif; \n" +
            "            text-align: center; \n" +
            "            padding: 40px;\n" +
            "            background-color: #f9f9f9;\n" +
            "        }\n" +
            "        .greeting {\n" +
            "            font-size: 0.7rem;\n" +
            "            color: #d23c67;\n" +
            "            margin-bottom: 20px;\n"+
            "            font-weight: bold;\n" +

            "            top: 4.78rem;\n"+
            "            left: 53%;\n"+
            "            z-index: 99;\n"+
            "        }\n" +

            "        }\n" +

            "</head>\n" +
           "<body>\n" +
           "    <div class=\"greeting\">Dear " + firstName + "</div>\n" +
           "    <img class=\"birthday-img\" src=\"https://mobileapps.ev5.in/images/wish-birthday-image.jpg\" alt=\"Birthday Celebration\">\n" +
           "</body>\n" +
           "</html>";
}

answers.body:
1. Do not use position absolute
  2. Do not use "newfangled measurements" like rem
  3. Do not use percentages
  4. Don't use fixed width
  5. Use inline styles

And I would use a template string instead of all that concatenation

public static String generateBirthdayHtml(String fullName) {
    String firstName = extractFirstName(fullName);
    System.out.println("First Name: " + firstName);

    String template = """
        <html>
        <head>
            <title>Birthday Greeting</title>
        </head>
        <body style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif; text-align: center; padding: 40px; background-color: #f9f9f9;">
            <div style="font-size: 14px; color: #d23c67; margin-bottom: 20px; font-weight: bold;">Dear ${firstName}</div>
            <div>
                <img style="width: 300px; max-width: 100%;" src="https://mobileapps.ev5.in/images/wish-birthday-image.jpg" alt="Birthday Celebration">
            </div>
        </body>
        </html>
        """;

    return template.replace("${firstName}", firstName);
}
